questionListItems.title: Can I access my family/member’s personal information? Will my personal information be released to another family/ household member?

answer.body: It is important for an individual’s personal information to be used only with his/her knowledge and consent. We will not disclose the personal information of an individual to another person, unless he/she is authorised to act on that individual’s behalf. Similarly, we will not disclose your personal information to your family/household member, unless he/ she is acting on your behalf legally; or you have provided written agreement to instruct us to share your information.

questionListItems.title: I have a very urgent query on HOMES/ HOMES-related issue. Who can I talk to?

answer.body: Please visit HOMES webpage to provide your contact details and a brief description of your query. We will get back to you as soon as we can.

questionListItems.title: Will I be notified each time my personal information has been accessed or used in HOMES? Has HOMES accessed or used my personal information?

answer.body:
No. You will not be notified of each access or use of your personal information in HOMES.


If you wish to know if your personal information has been accessed or used by the Participating Schemes or HOMES, you may submit a request by visiting the HOMES webpage and providing your contact information. We seek your understanding that we may not be able to disclose the full details of all access or use of your personal information in HOMES.

questionListItems.title: The data you have of me on the eService is inaccurate. How do I update them?

answer.body: Please drop us a line via the Contact Us page on the HOMES webpage for us to assist with your request.

questionListItems.title: Can I make changes to the clauses or Terms of Consent in the consent form?

answer.body: No. We are not able to accept any changes to the HOMES consent forms or consent clauses. Any changes made to the consent form or clauses will render the consent void.

questionListItems.title: Can I provide transactional type of consent e.g. one-time?

answer.body: This option is currently not supported. To minimise hassle to you and your family when you renew or reapply to participating schemes, the consents you have given for the application of the participating schemes will remain valid and continuous until withdrawn.

questionListItems.title: What should I do if any of my family members are unable to sign the consent form? Can I sign on his/her behalf?

answer.body:
It is important for an individual's personal data to be used only with one's own knowledge and consent. If he/she is at least 21 years old and has the mental capacity to understand the Terms of Consent, he/she should provide consent himself/herself.


If you have a family member in your application who is unable to provide consent (e.g. overseas, no authorised representative) to allow government schemes to access their personal data, please inform the government scheme to discuss how to proceed with your application.

questionListItems.title: Who can provide consent in the application to the scheme? Can I give consent for all my family members?

answer.body:
An individual’s personal data should only be used with his/her knowledge and consent. Persons who are (i) at least 21 years old based on date of birth at the point of consent signing; (ii) with sufficient mental capacity to understand the Terms of Consent, should provide consent for themselves. For the following groups (Exceptions) who are unable to provide consent themselves, their authorised representative(s) can provide consent on their behalf:


 

Exceptions

Authorised Representative(s)

a)


Minor below the age of majority (i.e. 21 years old) based on date of birth at the point of signing the consent form

  • Birth/Adoptive Parent of the minor and/or

  • Legal Guardian of the minor

b)


Mentally incapacitated (must be certified by a Singapore-registered doctor)


  • Donee(s)* under a Registered Lasting Power of Attorney

  • Court-appointed Deput(ies)* under the Mental Capacity Act.

c)


Deceased

  • Executor, or Administrator of the Estate


* If the Donee or Deputy is appointed to only act jointly for the incapacitated person, then all the appointed Donees and Deputies must provide consent on behalf together for him/her.

questionListItems.title: I received a call/email/letter claiming they are from HOMES. Are they legitimate?

answer.body:
HOMES, the Household Means Eligibility System, is a Government system supporting public schemes in their conduct of means-tests as part of their assessment in determining the level of assistance for them. You or your family member may have confirmed your household composition or applied for assistance from one of the public schemes tapping on HOMES. These schemes are listed on the HOMES webpage. Applicants may be contacted by the HOMES Ops team via phone, email or letter, if there is a need to clarify the household information they or their family members had provided for the application of assistance from the public scheme.


You may find out more about HOMES via MOH website listing of e-Services or directly access the website https://www.homes.gov.sg/eservice/. If you have any query on HOMES, you may visit HOMES webpage to provide your contact details and a brief description of your query. We will get back to you as soon as we can.


If you are unsure of the authenticity of the mobile number that you have received, please call our hotline 6818 1422 for confirmation.

questionListItems.title: I have queries on the consent which I am to give/ have given to HOMES for my means-test/ scheme application. Who can I talk to?

answer.body: Please visit HOMES webpage to provide your contact details and a brief description of your query.  We will get back to you as soon as we can.

questionListItems.title: Can the scheme use my personal information without my consent? What are some examples where my consent is not required for the scheme to access or use my personal information?

answer.body:
Schemes can collect, use and share your personal information without your consent if the purpose of doing so is permitted or required by law, or is in the public interest. Some examples include relying on the Public Sector Governance Act (PSGA) to disclose data for the purpose of improving (directly or indirectly) the efficiency or effectiveness of policies, programme management or service planning and delivery. This example is one of the 7 purposes set out in the PSGA for which identifiable data can be shared without consent.


However, personal information about you that is legislatively locked such as your financial information cannot be accessed by the schemes without first obtaining your consent.

questionListItems.title: What measures are there to protect personal information from unauthorised access, misuse, or breach?

answer.body:
Your personal information can only be accessed for official purposes and on a need-to-know basis by users who are authorised by the schemes and have signed an undertaking to observe the governance and legal requirements.

All access is controlled and monitored. Regular reviews of users and audits are also conducted to investigate or detect any anomalies or suspected cases of unauthorised access and misuse of personal information.

The government considers all cases of unauthorised access, misuse, or breach of confidentiality as serious matters.

If you have any other questions on consent, please contact us via the enquiry form on the HOMES webpage.

questionListItems.title: I am asked to complete outstanding actions on the HOMES eService, but I do not have a Singpass account to log in to e-Service. What can I do?

answer.body:
You can register for a Singpass account at https://www.singpass.gov.sg if you are a/an;


  • Singapore Citizen and Permanent Resident

  • Employment Pass (EP) and Personalised Employment Pass (PEP) holders

  • EntrePass holders

  • S-Pass holders

  • Dependent Pass holders (of EP, PEP, EntrePass and S-Pass holders)

  • Long Term Visit Pass-Plus (LTVP+) holders

  • Long Term Visit Pass holders

  • Selected Work Permit Holders who require Singpass to access government digital services

Please note that the minimum age requirement for a Singpass account is 15 years old.


Alternatively, you may ask a family/household member who is included in your household, to log in to HOMES eService with his/her Singpass and help perform the actions required.


Please contact the HOMES Ops officer who was the liaison for your case, via email or HOMES hotline 6818 1422 (from Mondays to Fridays (excluding Public Holidays) between 8.30am and 5.30pm) for assistance, if completing your actions on the HOMES eService is not a viable option for you.

questionListItems.title: I am unable to login to the HOMES eService. Why is that the case?

answer.body:
The information and services on the HOMES eService are available to the following groups of individuals who have 2FA-enabled Singpass accounts:

i)   Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents

ii)  Valid FIN holders who are known to be related to a Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident


If you have successfully logged in with your Singpass account but are unable to access the HOMES eService, please visit HOMES webpage to provide your contact details, the error message displayed and your Singpass account user ID, for us to further assist you.


Alternatively, if you are already in contact with HOMES Ops team, you may contact the officer via email or HOMES hotline 6818 1422 (from Mondays to Fridays (excluding Public Holidays) between 8.30am and 5.30pm) for assistance.

questionListItems.title: I have just been logged out of HOMES eService due to another login with my account! What should I do?

answer.body:
If you suspect that your Singpass account has been compromised, we strongly advise you to take the following actions:

  • Reset your Singpass password immediately to prevent unauthorised access to your account.

  • Lodge a police report at any Neighbourhood Centre/Post or via the Electronic Police Centre website.

  • Email GovTech at qsm@tech.gov.sg to highlight your case to the Administrator.


Please also visit HOMES webpage to provide your contact information and the details of the case (time and date) for us to conduct further investigations.
